climatePledgeFriendly.details: Pre-owned Certified: Electronics products are inspected, cleaned and (if applicable) repaired to excellent functional standards. Buying Pre-owned extends a product's life, reducing e-waste and raw material extraction.

body.description: This pre-owned or refurbished product has been professionally inspected and tested to work and look like new. How a product becomes part of Amazon Renewed, your destination for pre-owned, refurbished products: A customer buys a new product and returns it or trades it in for a newer or different model. That product is inspected and tested to work and look like new by Amazon-qualified suppliers. Then, the product is sold as an Amazon Renewed product on Amazon. If not satisfied with the purchase, renewed products are eligible for replacement or refund under the Amazon Renewed Guarantee.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2016
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars It is great quality. It has lasted during all kinds of ...
reviews.reviewText: I use this watch when I am walking and running. It is great quality. It has lasted during all kinds of weather and many running journeys. I like that you can set it for walks or runs so it fits everyone's needs. I like that it tracks your runs and walks and you can plug it into your tablet or phone to track it in the long term. It has helped me meet some of my goals. A good quality product for the money. I wold recommend this product and company to others, I will be buying more.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 3, 2015
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great, low-cost GPS watch
reviews.reviewText: THE GOOD: Does everything you'd want from a GPS watch. I had an old Garmin that was clunky and odd shaped, but this is more like a real watch (albeit a bit thicker). It's easy to use and it's easy to upload your data to the Garmin web site to track your activities. You can also download your activity in a GPX or TCX format so you can upload it to other sites like Runkeeper, which I have used for years. The Garmin site is very similar and I may switch to it eventually, but old habits are hard to break (plus I have 6 years of data on Runkeeper).THE BAD: A little slow to acquire GPS...maybe 30 seconds to a minute. Runkeeper on my Android phone acquires them instantly.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 9, 2015
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Only 5 hour battery
reviews.reviewText: Bought this certified refurbished for my wife for her first marathon . As advertised, the battery only lasted 5 hours continuously with GPS turned on. Unfortunately I did not see that in the description before i bought it. The battery did not last and died on her in the middle of the race. Other than the battery issue it worked well. Just be aware that if you are a "back of the pack marathon runner", this will not make it to the end.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 20, 2015
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great starter running watch.
reviews.reviewText: I bought this for my 15 year old son to use for his cross country season. Since he is 15 and loses everything, I didn't want to spend a lot of money for a running watch, but this was the year he really seemed to want to work to improve his time. This watch seems to find a signal pretty quickly, and is easy to use. When using as a watch without the GPS function, it can go about a week without a charge. We received the watch, as well as the charger with our purchase, and everything seems to work as if it was new.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 16, 2016
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Does the job
reviews.reviewText: Works fine. Seems accurate about times and distances. Provides flexibility on route which can be nice. No mapping the new route every time you vary a bit. .Some difficulty getting it to work with MapMyRun app but I prefer to enter things by hand so that's not a problem for me.As others have noted, it takes a while to locate itself pre-run. Controls aren't initially intuitive but I expect they will be with repitition.Thought at first the size would bother me. Much larger than my simple wrist stopwatch but that hasn't been a problem.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 26, 2018
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars Won't hold a charge
reviews.reviewText: Battery will not hold a charge. I shouldn't have bough a refurbished unit. Garmin told me it would cost $79.00 to replace the battery which is more than I paid for the device. It worked great when it actually worked.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 22, 2016
reviews.reviewText: I bought this watch for my husband 1 month ago. He has used it about 15-20 times, and it has done exactly what he wanted it to do. He could not be happier with the purchase. (He is typing this review from my perspective, and no, he does not see anything wrong with that.)I'll update this if anything changes.Updating this review to reflect that this purchase is now 3 years old, and my husband still loves it! He loves how basic and bare-bones it is. They don't make them like that anymore. We just had to change the battery, which was a cheap and easy DIY.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 17, 2015
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Does what it needs to do, and great battery life. :)
reviews.reviewText: Great tool for long runs. Let's me know how long I've been running and how far, avg. mile, keeps track of my 1 mile splits to keep me on target. Does exactly what I need it to do and is much better than trying to do the same with an app through a phone that is stuck to your arm. I've run 4 hours and 40 mins with this and the battery didn't even start to blink that it was getting low. So, the battery life on this is great too...just make sure it's fully charged before you leave. I made the mistake of thinking I could just waltz out the door without having it fully charged since my previous run wasn't that long, but I didn't take into consideration the fact that the battery is still running when it sits on the shelf, just keeping time. So, I had to cut my run short. Otherwise, this thing goes and goes. :)
Garmin no falla, es garantia de calidad, desde 5 hasta maraton,fácil de usar sin muchos botones, solo 2 clics para empezar a correr, aprox 30 seg para obtener GPS

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on February 4, 2017
reviews.reviewText: Great Watch! Cheap and simple! GPS finds pretty fast, especially fast when not in built up areas. Good for tracking runs which is what I mainly use it for. Easily able to upload data to Strava app which is cool! def worth the money because of the low price!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on May 26, 2016
reviews.reviewText: Great little entry level item. Bought as a gift for our little boy who is taking his first steps as a runner.. He loves it & so do we

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on August 28, 2016
reviews.reviewTitle: Refurbished unit is great value compared to new item
reviews.reviewText: Refurbished unit is great value compared to new item. Basic functions but picks up GPS signal well. Battery life is okay, must remember to fully charge prior to a long run. Would estimate a full charge gives about 3-4 hours so probably not a good choice for marathons. I use the virtual pace function so battery may last longer if this function turned off.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on July 31, 2016
reviews.reviewTitle: Works perfect. No need to buy new
reviews.reviewText: Brand new condition in original box with all the equipment and manual. Works perfect. No need to buy new. Save your money and buy one of these refurbs.
